title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Fox University
Interview Descriptions: Several steps in the interview process, overly complicated for the level of position. Met with several different departments. Several steps in the interview process, overly complicated for the level of position. Met with several different departments.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your daily work?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Fox University (Portland, OR) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Started with an initial virtual interview that was about 30 minutes where they allowed me to ask only one question. Second round was an in person interview with 4 members of the admissions team where I was allowed to ask multiple questions at the end.
Interview Questions: How will you incorporate DEI into your daily work? Why should we hire you?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Long but not hard. Didn’t talk to me at all about lifestyle agreement. Was actually no talk about Christianity at all. I guess it depends on which department you interview with.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions. Nothing innovative or interesting.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Fox University
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and job specific detailed interview.  While I was qualified for the position described, also asked questions regarding Church attendance. Asked questions about my management style and what type of management skills are important.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in the educational environment before.

title: Admissions Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Fox University
Interview Descriptions:
Requires applicants to sign a statement of faith, which includes questions concerning an applicant's "lifestyle" and a statement expressing that the organization only accepts heterosexual applicants, among other requirements. 

While I do technically live a "lifestyle" that would qualify me for this position, including current membership with a church, I was uncomfortable enough with the amount of information required about applicants' personal lives and about the bigoted views expressed by this organization. I was not familiar with George Fox University before beginning to apply and declined to complete my application. I would encourage others to consider this organization's views before applying.
Interview Questions: Explain any reservations or lack of understanding you may have concerning the Community Lifestyle Statement:

title: IT Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Fox University (Beaverton, OR) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a phone call with the supervisor where I was asked questions about my skills. Then my references were called and afterwards the supervisor got back to me about a job offer.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have answering phone calls?

title: IT Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Fox University (Beaverton, OR) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a phone call with the supervisor where I was asked questions about my skills. Then my references were called and afterwards the supervisor got back to me about a job offer.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have answering phone calls?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at George Fox University (Portland, OR) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very thoughtful and prompt communication. The professionalism is one of the best among Christian universities I’ve worked at. There were email, phone and in-person interviews over the course of about 1 month.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose this school to teach at?

title: Building Repair Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Fox University
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy, not really difficult.
As long as you are nice and competent of tools and are good and communication, you will have no problem
Doesn't really ask hard questions, just if you are dependable and a good worker
Interview Questions: Are you okay with heights

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at George Fox University
Interview Descriptions: The title is Director but the job is not very advanced. The interview was completely over the top for the level of job. It was a two day process involving several departments on campus. Most people involved in the interview seemed to be there not by choice. Most seemed to think it was excessive too.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First of all, I submitted my resume, cover letter, general application, and signed the statement of faith. About two weeks later, I received additional general questions for screening. 
On the next round, the hiring manager and his direct supervisor followed up for a phone interview. After a week, I had a panel interview with cross-department teams for three hours. A week later, I was interviewed by a C level executive.
Interview Questions: Examples: (1) Tell us about yourself, (2) What do you expect from your supervisor?, (3) How are you familiar with XYZ?, (4) In your resume, you had this ABC skill, what does it mean? (5) Describe your experience working with department teams? (6) Tell me why we should select you instead of other candidates? (7) What would be your potential challenge/obstacle on this new position?

title: Unarmed Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying for the position, the Director of Security selected from the applications who he would interview. The interview was casual and was some general questions about who I was, my work ethic and past experiences.
Interview Questions: Where have you traveled to?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Emailed in a filled-in PDF application, including statement of faith, with my resume and cover letter. Initial communication was by email. I was invited to campus for an interview. Interview was friendly but serious. After the interview, I received a job offer by phone. Was able to negotiate salary a bit.
Interview Questions: Was quizzed on a number of technical details.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was sent some documents about the university and the position prior to the interview, which was promising and gave me time to properly prepare. However, the interviews were disorganized and rarely focused on the position. The questions I prepared for were never asked, and the majority of the questions were related to my faith and Christianity in general.
Interview Questions: What similarities does George Fox and the Rev. Billy Graham have in common?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process with panels of administrative staff, students, faculty and executive team. Thoughtful questions.  I interviewed for 8 straight hours with quick 5 minute breaks in between hour long sessions. The time flew by as the questions and dialogue was easy and thoughtful.  I had the opportunity to privately ask students if they liked their education experience and to ask the staff pros and cons of working at the university.
Interview Questions: What message would I deliver to undergraduate students during a 20 minute chapel sermon?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was fairly easy. You are hired online, it didn't take much to get an interview. After the interview, you're practically a shoe-in. Plant Services isn't very glamorous and is all the way by the softball field. The interview is just you and one other person (the head honcho) and they ask questions pertinent to the position of office assistant- I felt prepared for what they asked.
Interview Questions: Can you lift 10-20 lbs?

title: Campus Security Guard Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: After applying to the job the previous spring, I received a phone call from the director of campus security asking about my previous employment and ability to function under stressful situations. He was cordial and seemed competent and well-organized. There were some humorous questions like, "can you leap over tall buildings in a single bound" and the like. After answering all the questions he said he would be in touch and I got a phone call and email letting me know I had the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with a difficult coworker.

title: Administrative Staff Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Fox University (Newberg, OR) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly phone interview then group interview. Lots of questions, Christian college so they ask about your spiritual journey, what kind of books do you like to read and what kind of supervisor do you like. Situational questions were asked as well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Fox University
Interview Descriptions: Several steps in the interview process, overly complicated for the level of position. Met with several different departments. Several steps in the interview process, overly complicated for the level of position. Met with several different departments.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your daily work?
